column2: About Company       ReNew is a leading decarbonisation solutions provider and the first Indian clean energy company to list on Nasdaq (Nasdaq: RNW). With ~13.7 GW of commissioned and pipeline utility-scale projects, we are a global company with strong Indian roots. Founded in 2011, ReNew is at the forefront of fighting climate change by offering decarbonisation solutions through utility-scale wind and solar offerings, green hydrogen, carbon markets, and energy storage. ReNew has been a pioneer in leveraging digital technologies to accelerate the transition to green energy and address the unique requirements of the B2B segment in India, where we are the market leader. Our mission is to play a pivotal role in meeting India?? growing energy needs in an efficient, sustainable, and socially responsible manner. ReNew is the world?? first clean energy company to be recognised as a Lighthouse by the World Economic Forum. In 2023, we were recognised among ??op 15 Climate Tech Companies to Watch??by the MIT Technology Review. We are a recipient of the Sustainable Market Initiative?? Terra Carta Seal. The COP28 UAE Presidency presented ReNew the ??nergy Transition Changemaker??award for developing and deploying the country?? first round-the-clock power project. column2: Role Objective: A key objective of this position is to ensure the seamless functioning of plant machinery through effective preventive maintenance, timely rectification of breakdowns and efficient operation of plant machinery and utilities. Manage maintenance schedules, audits and documentation to uphold ISO and GMP standards, contributing to the overall reliability and cost-effectiveness of the facility. Desired Candidate Profile: Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or related field. Proven experience in maintenance management, preferably in a pharmaceutical or manufacturing setting. In-depth knowledge of preventive and breakdown maintenance practices. Familiarity with ISO and GMP standards. Strong organizational and leadership skills. Excellent problem-solving abilities. Effective communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines. Role & Responsibilities: Implement preventive maintenance schedules for plant machinery, recording activities in compliance with the designated time frame. Rectify breakdowns promptly, minimizing downtime, and maintain comprehensive records of major and minor breakdowns. Oversee the maintenance of Reverse Osmosis (RO), Deionized Water (DM), and Water for Injection (WFI) facilities, generating and maintaining relevant reports. Operate plant machinery and utilities, ensuring adherence to ISO and GMP standards, and maintaining accurate records. Take ownership of the Annual Maintenance schedule for both plant and utility machinery, ensuring completion within specified timeframes. Lead internal and external audits, ensuring the closure of non-conformities (NC) and maintaining compliance with quality standards. Verify and manage documentation evidence (IQ, OQ, PQ) for the installation of new machinery. Implement modifications in existing facilities to minimize breakdown hours and reduce maintenance costs. Efficiently manage allocated work, providing necessary materials, and offering clear guidelines. Ensure the timely closure of work orders. Develop and manage shift schedules, ensuring the presence of designated personnel during duty hours. Establish effective communication with agencies and contractors, providing necessary support and facilities. Maintain minimum stock levels (MSL) for required materials. Collaborate with the Stores and Utility departments to facilitate the procurement and provision of materials. Functional Skill Required: Preventive and breakdown maintenance expertise. Auditing and documentation management. Operation and maintenance of plant machinery and utilities. Project management for facility modifications. Inventory management and procurement.   Behavioural Skill Required: Leadership and team management. Effective communication and interpersonal skills. Problem-solving and decision-making. Time management and adherence to deadlines. Attention to detail and quality orientation.   Team Size to be Handle:  Manage the team of 10 to 12 team members. Biotech is an Equal Opportunity Organization promoting diversity while ensuring no discrimination on any ground including gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, etc.
column11: Breakdown Maintenance, Inventory Management, Preventive maintenance, Inventory Control, SAP, maintenance Opex budget

column2: Operations Management: Assist in the day-to-day operations of the power plant and utility systems, ensuring the production and distribution of electricity, steam, and other utilities run smoothly     Maintenance Supervision: Oversee maintenance activities, including preventive and corrective maintenance, to ensure equipment and systems are in good working condition     Safety Compliance: Enforce safety protocols and procedures to maintain a safe working environment and adhere to regulatory safety standards     Staff Management: Supervise and coordinate the work of operators, technicians, and other personnel in the power plant and utility operations     Resource Allocation: Allocate resources efficiently, including manpower, equipment, and materials, to meet production and maintenance goals     Performance Monitoring: Continuously monitor the performance of the power plant and utility systems, and take corrective actions as needed to maintain efficiency and reliability     Regulatory Compliance: Ensure that the power plant and utility operations adhere to environmental, safety, and industry regulations and standards     Budget Management: Assist in budget planning and control for the department, managing expenses, and seeking cost-effective solutions     Emergency Response: Develop and implement emergency response plans to address unexpected outages, accidents, or equipment failures     Energy Efficiency: Explore and implement strategies to optimize energy generation and utility distribution to reduce costs and environmental impact     Environmental Sustainability: Implement practices and technologies that support sustainability and environmental goals, such as reducing emissions and water consumption     Record Keeping: Maintain records and documentation related to equipment maintenance, safety procedures, and operational performance     Project Management: Participate in projects related to the expansion, upgrading, or modification of power plant and utility systems

column1: Manager / Senior Manager- Blast Furnace Power Systems
column2: Greetings from Manpower Resources India Pvt. Ltd.  We have been mandated by a large conglomerate for the below mentioned role & we found your skill sets & credentials are quite aligned.  Manpower Resources India Pvt. Ltd. , a leading Executive Search & Selection Company offers services to Manufacturing, Engineering, Infrastructure & Healthcare domain.  Position:  Manager/Senior Manager- Blast Furnace Power Systems  Experience : 10+ Years  Location: Chaliyama, Jharkhand Educational Qualification- BE/B. Tech/Diploma-Electrical Job Purpose: The incumbent will be responsible for overseeing the planning, operation, maintenance, and management of electrical power systems in a blast furnace facility. This role requires expertise in electrical engineering, experience in heavy industrial environments, and strong leadership skills.  Key Responsibilities:   Operations Management : Oversee the daily operation of the blast furnace power systems, ensuring optimal performance, safety, and efficiency. Maintenance and Troubleshooting : Develop and implement maintenance schedules to minimize downtime. Diagnose and resolve electrical issues within the blast furnace and associated systems. Safety Compliance : Ensure compliance with safety regulations and industry standards. Conduct safety audits and risk assessments as needed. Team Leadership : Lead a team of electrical engineers, technicians, and other staff. Provide training, mentorship, and performance feedback. Project Management : Plan and execute projects related to power system upgrades, expansions, or other modifications to enhance plant operations. Quality Assurance : Ensure that all electrical systems meet quality standards and industry best practices. Budget Management : Develop and manage budgets for the power systems department. Monitor expenses and identify cost-saving opportunities. Collaboration and Communication : Work closely with other departments (e.g., operations, maintenance, safety, engineering) to coordinate activities and ensure smooth plant operations. Continuous Improvement : Identify and implement process improvements to enhance efficiency, reliability, and safety. Vendor Management : Manage relationships with external vendors, contractors, and suppliers for electrical equipment and services. Documentation and Reporting : Maintain accurate records of maintenance, repairs, safety incidents, and other relevant data. Prepare reports for senior management as required. Qualifications : Strong knowledge of electrical systems, including transformers, substations, switchgear, and control systems. Experience with automation and industrial control systems (e.g., PLCs, SCADA). Understanding of safety regulations and industry standards related to power systems in heavy industry. Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills. Strong leadership and team management abilities. Effective communication skills, both written and verbal. Project management experience and skills. Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.

column2: Job Title: Quantity Surveyor - Fire Protection Safety and Security Systems Location: Hyderabad (Telangana) Company Overview : We at  Saini Electronic Security Systems  to be one of the premier providers of fire and security solutions in India. We provide innovative and cost-effective solutions to the fire and security needs for clients in many different industries. From a single location to franchises throughout the region and the country, our integrated approach saves our clients valuable time, money and stress! We feature state-of-the-art, innovative products and services to keep our clients on the cutting edge of technology and compliance. We monitor all of our clients??services in-house, so we can maximize the synergy and the savings for your business. We??e committed to giving our customers professional, fast, comprehensive and cost-effective results - on time and on budget. We look forward to serving all of your company's fire and security needs -- today and in the future! Position Overview : We are seeking a skilled Quantity Surveyor to join our team specializing in the fire protection, safety, and security systems industry. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in quantity surveying with specific expertise in estimating, cost control, and project management within this specialized sector. This role involves working closely with stakeholders to ensure accurate cost estimation, procurement, and financial management throughout the lifecycle of projects in fire protection, safety, and security systems. Responsibilities : 1 . Cost Estimation : Utilize industry knowledge and specialized expertise to accurately estimate the costs associated with fire protection, safety, and security systems projects. 2.  Quantity Takeoff : Conduct detailed quantity takeoffs and measurements for materials, labor, and equipment required for projects. 3.  Procurement : Collaborate with procurement teams to source materials and equipment, ensuring quality and cost-effectiveness while adhering to project specifications. 4.  Budgeting and Cost Control : Develop and maintain project budgets, monitoring costs throughout the project lifecycle to identify and address variances. 5.  Tendering Process : Prepare tender documents, evaluate bids, and negotiate contracts with subcontractors and suppliers. 6.  Value Engineering : Identify opportunities for value engineering to optimize project costs without compromising quality or safety standards. 7.  Change Management : Assess and manage variations and change orders, evaluating their impact on project costs and timelines. 8.  Risk Management : Identify and mitigate potential risks related to cost, schedule, and quality, ensuring projects are delivered within budget and on schedule. 9.  Project Reporting : Prepare accurate and timely financial reports, providing stakeholders with insights into project costs, forecasts, and financial performance. 10.  Compliance : Ensure compliance with relevant regulations, codes, and standards governing fire protection, safety, and security systems projects.     Qualifications : 1. Any Bachelor's degree, 2. Proven experience as a Quantity Surveyor, with a focus on fire protection, safety, and security systems projects. 3. Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and building codes related to fire protection, safety, and security systems. 4. Excellent analytical and numerical skills, with the ability to accurately estimate costs and analyze project data. 5. Effective communication and negotiation skills, with the ability to collaborate with internal teams, subcontractors, and clients. 6. Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills, capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously. 7. Knowledge of relevant legislation, regulations, and industry standards governing fire protection, safety, and security systems. Join our team and contribute to the successful delivery of innovative fire protection, safety, and security systems projects.  ** Interested candidates  can share their latest resume with the details like your current CTC, salary expectation & notice period to join to hr@sainisystem.com  OR  Whatsapp us on 7506221605 ??Deepa Malkani, HR Manager, Safe Pvt. Ltd.

column2: FLO - Projects:      About CMR       CMR Green Technologies Limited formerly known as is Indias largest producer of Aluminium and Zinc die-casting alloys with a combined annual capacity of over approx. 4, 18, 000 MT per annum. Since its inception in 2006, it has maintained its fast-paced growth by leveraging latest technology and continuous improvement. CMR, which recycles aluminium scrap to make alloy, has 28-30 percent market share in India and is nearly three times larger than its nearest competitor. column2: Role & responsibilities  :   Key Responsibilities: TPM Leadership:  Lead TPM implementation efforts across the designated plants, utilizing the TPM Pillar Methodology, collaborating internally with plant teams and externally with consultant partners to ensure successful deployment. Overall Equipment Effectiveness (0EE%) Monitoring:  Monitor 0EE% across various technologies, machine types, and plants, and devise improvement action plans to optimize equipment effectiveness and minimize downtime. Establishing Review Systems:  Establish and maintain a robust review system at the shop floor and plant level, including daily, weekly, and monthly reviews. Ensure that these reviews facilitate effective communication, problem-solving, and decision-making to drive TPM initiatives forward. Driving Throughput/OEE Improvement Initiatives:  Spearhead Throughput Improvement initiatives across all units within the plant., ensuring alignment with organizational objectives and timelines. Horizontal Deployment of Improvements:  Facilitate the horizontal deployment of improvement initiatives across different units within the plant, fostering collaboration and sharing of best practices. Coordination and Collaboration:  Maintain close coordination with plant teams and external consultants to ensure seamless execution of TPM initiatives, addressing any bottlenecks or issues that may arise during implementation. Requirements: Bachelors degree in engineering or related field. Proven experience in TPM implementation and project management within manufacturing environments. Certified TPM Facilitator: Serve as a certified TPM facilitator, leveraging prior experience in leading TPM deployments across multiple plants. Previous participation in Plant TPM JIPM Certification would be advantageous. Proficiency in MS Office, especially MS Excel and MS PowerPoint. Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and generate actionable insights. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams. Preferred candidate profile: B.E/ B.Tech in Engineering  Perks and benefits  :  Best in the industry

Excellent communication skills (both spoken and written) in Hindi are necessary for this position, and familiarity with local dialects such as Bhojpuri, Magahi, or Maithili will be an added advantage. The ability to prepare and send regular progress and monitoring reports in English will be an added advantage.            About the Role          The District Coordinators will have to manage the implementation and operations at the district level including the management of the Block Coordinators and community workers, coordination with the partner organization on field requirements, coordination with the technical team, convergence with concerned government departments, and monitoring of project activities at the block level. They will have to support the senior project management team in synthesizing knowledge from the field, coordinating with partner organizations, district-level convergence with government departments, writing reports and updates, evaluation-related work, etc.        Responsibilities      :          Attending the training/orientation program conducted by the Project Management team to understand the project background, objectives, interventions, target group, timelines, geographic coverage, progress, and performance monitoring tools, and the impact evaluation plan.      Preparing and submitting, for approval, to the Project Manager a detailed implementation plan for the assigned district for the interventions shortlisted during the User Testing phase.          Identifying, interviewing, selecting, and orienting the required number and profile of Block Coordinators with the project background, objectives, and their job functions & responsibilities.          Assisting the Project Manager in training the Block and Community Coordinators for implementing each program intervention by explaining its purpose, target group (primary & secondary), implementation steps, use of promotional tools, and the expected outcomes from each intervention.      Traveling to the assigned villages to supervise and monitor the work of Block and Community Coordinators on a day-to-day basis.      Achieving the implementation targets assigned by the Project Manager, in terms of coverage area and beneficiary households, smooth functioning of Block and Community Coordinators, and the expected results & desired outcomes from each intervention.          Identifying and resolving the problems/issues/challenges faced by the Block and Community Coordinators in discharging their day-to-day duties, and updating the Project Manager about the project progress and performance through weekly feedback.      Escalating the difficult problems/issues to Project Manager for resolution, implementing the solutions provided by the Project Manager and updating the Project Manager about the effectiveness of the solutions provided.          Providing feedback to the Project Coordinator for resolving the coordination related issues with stakeholder departments such as Health Department, Railways, JEEViKA, ICDS and other stakeholders for smooth implementation of the program interventions.      Providing input into the design and implementation of the Baseline and Endline Surveys to be conducted by the project partner Population Council.      Updating the Project Manager on the project progress and performance on a regular basis and analyzing the performance indicators and taking corrective actions/measures to ensure achievement of project objectives as per the agreed timelines.

column2: Roles and Responsibilities     Operating Decanter Equipment:  Operate and monitor decanter equipment used in the separation and clarification of liquids, typically in the context of distillation processes. Process Monitoring:  Monitor the decanter operation to ensure that it is functioning correctly and producing the desired results in terms of liquid separation and clarity. Quality Control:  Ensure that the separated liquids meet quality standards and specifications, including alcohol content, purity, and clarity, by performing regular quality checks and adjustments as necessary. Safety Procedures:  Adhere to safety protocols and guidelines while operating the decanter equipment, including proper handling of hazardous materials and wearing appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE). Equipment Maintenance:  Perform routine maintenance tasks on the decanter equipment, such as cleaning, lubrication, and minor repairs, to ensure optimal performance and longevity. Troubleshooting:  Identify and troubleshoot any issues or malfunctions with the decanter equipment, diagnosing the root cause of problems and implementing corrective actions to minimize downtime. Productivity Optimization:  Optimize decanter operation parameters, such as speed, temperature, and flow rates, to maximize productivity while maintaining product quality and efficiency. Documentation:  Maintain accurate records of decanter operation parameters, production volumes, and quality control data for reporting purposes and process optimization. Team Collaboration:  Coordinate with other production team members, such as distillation operators and quality control technicians, to ensure smooth operation and alignment with production goals. Continuous Improvement:  Identify opportunities for process improvements and efficiency enhancements in decanter operations, such as automation upgrades or procedural optimizations, and provide feedback to management. Environmental Compliance:  Ensure compliance with environmental regulations and standards related to decanter operation, such as waste management practices and resource conservation measures. Training and Development:  Stay updated on industry best practices and new technologies related to decanter operation through training and professional development opportunities, and share knowledge with colleagues as appropriate.
column11: Distillation, operations, Operator For Decanter, decanter operator, Chemical, Operating

Must have skills : NEXThink Good to have skills : Microsoft Power BI Minimum  5  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : BE Graduate Roles & Responsibilities:1.Gather requirements from business stakeholders to understand and address their needs effectively and independently.2.Analyze performance issues related to devices and applications, providing insights for optimization.3.Create custom reports and dashboards to visualize key metrics and aid in decision-making.4.Continuously measure end-user satisfaction based on established metrics to enhance user experience.5.Deploy remediating scripts using the Act module to address and resolve identified issues promptly.6.Collaborate with internal teams, including Security, Operations, and Service Management, to showcase Nexthink's value and integration possibilities.7.Identify top call drivers and explore opportunities with Nexthink to reduce incident counts.8.Provide new insights to integrate Nexthink with existing solutions, enhancing overall system capabilities.  Professional & Technical Skills:1.Strong technical and architectural knowledge on Nexthink.2.Proficiency in automation and analytics tools.3.Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a strong business context understanding.4.Ability to interpret and present data in a non-technical manner.5.Capability to manage concurrent initiatives and work independently.6.Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate across multidisciplinary teams.7.Experience in Desktop management (Windows platform)8.Knowledge of digital experience monitoring or similar end-user experience-driven functions.9.Experience with Microsoft PowerBI Desktop.10.Experience in creating NXQL queries and proposing corrective actions.  Additional Information:1.Conduct proactive investigations based on real-time ticket data and service desk feedback.2.Identify and assess opportunities for automation and remote actions based on customer environments.3.Implement and test agreed-upon delivery of automation and remote actions to improve operational efficiency.4.Generate monthly reports on identified opportunities that provide additional customer value.5.Collaborate with project teams to drive better, data-driven outcomes and adoption through specific dashboards and insights. 6.Assess performance-risking changes for their impact on end-user experience management baselines and advise change implementors accordingly.7.Proficient in Nexthink, including Act and Engage modules, with detailed knowledge of Nexthink Portal and the ability to create custom dashboards.8.Scripting knowledge for Remote Actions and experience with Nexthink Finder9.Lead the team and train the team members on Nexthink and manage the team.10.Identify the opportunities to remotely execute the actions and plan for the auto-healing. Qualification BE Graduate

column2: Job description                  Join us as a Production Analyst            This is an opportunity to make a real impact and be pivotal in the success of our business,  while benefiting from great variety and stakeholder exposure       We ll look to you to deliver a production management,  infrastructure and application support service for relevant platforms,  activities and processes across the domain    Hone your existing analytical skills and advance your career in this exciting,  fast paced role    We're offering this role at senior analyst level         What you'll do       As a Production Analyst,  you ll support with providing day-to-day technology based services and will assist with deploying new applications and architecture across the domain.  We ll look to you to support the delivery of application management,  application support and the building of environments for systems,  making sure all deployments into production environments meet the appropriate quality standards.         It s a highly collaborative role which will see you working closely with platform and domain stakeholders to ensure the robustness and resilience of the platform.  You ll also work with feature teams to understand the upcoming changes and prevent potential issues occurring.         Your role will also involve:          Collaborating with product development and feature teams to understand the upcoming product,  enabling continuous integration and continuous deployment to occur    Regularly attending the feature teams  refinement and planning sessions    Identifying areas for service improvement by analysing and diagnosing re-occurring platform and service incidents,  as well as customer and stakeholder feedback    Building a culture of continuous improvement to reinforce the robustness of the domain,  with a focus on automation,  scalability,  continuous integration and continuous delivery         The skills you'll need       We re looking for someone with technical knowledge and experience including platform,  technology,  products and domains.  Along with this,  you ll bring experience of working in an Agile or DevOps environment with continuous delivery and continuous integration.         We re also looking for:          Knowledge and experience of industry standard toolsets and processes    Knowledge and experience of using operational principles    A very capable communicator with the ability to communicate complex technical concepts clearly to your peers and management level colleagues    Good collaboration and stakeholder management skills
column11: Production management, continuous integration, Automation, Application support, Production Analyst, Agile, Manager Technology, Stakeholder management, Continuous improvement, Operations

column2: Job Opportunity with Paint Manufacturing Industry   Role & responsibilities   1. Experience in driving such large sites independently ( 50 to 70 members team), should have successfully handled team of technicians & engineers.   2.Should be technically capable to address technical issues wrt mechanical, electrical & instrumentation.  3.Should be well conversant with operation & maintenance of utilities, EHS equipments and plant equipments. 4.Should be capable to address administrative aspects of site managements such as attrition, enhancing training skills, answering to customer and inculcating safety practices on shop floor. 5.Experience in handling maintenance of Process Plant Equipment & Facility services independently. 6. Should be well verse with high end automation ABB PLC , ABB DCS 800 and integration of various instrumentation required for paint process  7.High end automation in packing area with DCS system such as Delta PLC, delta drives, ATS EMS system with siemens PLCs ABB robots, filling, packing machine and associated with Diafuku and Auto mech  ASRS  systems. 8.Should be able to maintain all mechanical systems such as reactors, mixtures, silos, blowers, ASRS, EMS, robots and paint filling machines. Able to operate and maintain HT DG, HVAC system, AHUs, Hydraulic & pneumatic system, Fire fighting system, Dock levelers, Rolling shutter etc.  9. Knowledge of basic operating of utility and maintenance of plant equipment such as rotating Pumps ( centrifugal, screw, lobe ). Diesel/ Battery operated fleet equipments (e.g. forklift, tagger, scissor lift, elevators etc.).  12.Should have hands on experience in repairing various gear box, pumps, hydraulic system sand associated with control system and associated VFD and drives etc. 13.He should be able to read the drawings, trouble shoot mechanical & electrical faults. column2: Roles & Responsibilities:- # PNG RELATED ACTIVITY: Should have experience in SCADA, Automation, Mechanical & Electronic Gas Metering, Gas Loss and Gas reconciliation. Monitoring pipeline cathodic protection for pipelines under operation. Ensuring asset integrity requirements i.e. ECDA & ICDA compliances for steel pipeline network. Liaise with various govt. officials, ensure observance & fulfillment of statutory rules/compliances. Complying with the regulations prevailing in the state, coordination with internal customers, and vendors for O&M-related contracts, and keeping various records of O&M, for financial audit/technical audit/legal compliance purposes. The candidate will be responsible for planning, organizing, scheduling, and technical and safety requirements pertaining to CGD system for execution of operations and Maintenance works, starting from establishing and manning of control room, preparation and execution of the Annual Operation Maintenance Plan, covering scheduled monitoring, operation, maintenance, statutory compliance, audit and inspection, post commissioning services to customers including preparation, maintenance, and submission of various reports. He should ensure that operations and maintenance activities are being performed in line with the requirements of PNGRBs Technical Standards and Specifications including Safety Standards for CGD. Candidate should have hands-on experience in operations and handling of City Gate Station, Odorant unit, District Pressure Regulating Skid, Industrial Metering & Pressure Reduction skid, and Commercial and Domestic installations. Candidate should be able to manage operations and maintenance practices of steel and MDPE network  CP survey, PSP Monitoring, Steel Valves, LPT, LDT, Patrolling & Network Surveillance. The candidate shall be responsible for liasioning with local authorities/Govt bodies to ensure minimal third-party activity in the vicinity of the gas network. The candidate should plan and organize activities related to Joint Meter readings within the timeline to ensure timely billing of customers. The candidate will be responsible for gas reconciliation that includes preparation and timely submission of daily consumption reports and joint meter readings. Coordination with utility laying contractor and other civil contractors for ensuring ZERO MDPE damages & NIL ACCIDENTS. # CNG RELATED ACTIVITY: Responsible for proper operation and maintenance of CNG equipments like CNG compressors, DRS, Gas engines, CNG dispensers and CS pipeline facilities etc. Should be handling the commissioning of the Steel Pipeline network. Should be handling the erection, testing, and commissioning of CNG equipment involved at CNG stations & across the city. Should be capable of doing root cause analysis of failures, breakdown of CNG equipment like compressors, engines, motors, and pipelines etc. Planning, monitoring & control of Operation & Maintenance activities of CNG stations and Gas Pipeline network over various locations to ensure uninterrupted gas supply. Hands-on experience in major overhauling of gas engines & gas compressor packages etc and day-to-day monitoring of CNG compressors, dispensers, odourization unit and other O&M assets. The Candidate will be responsible for inventory management, especially for essential spares/assets management. Operation and maintenance of Gas receiving stations including Ultrasonic Meter, Flow computer, Gas chromatogram, Flow Control Valve, Odourisation system, regulating stations, Turbine/RPD meter, Electronic Meter, AMR system Experience Criteria:- Post: -  Senior Manager - O&M Grade: -  E-4 Upper Age Limit: -  39 Years Minimum Exp.: -  10 Years Experience or above in the Oil & Gas sector. Min. Fixed Salary:-  Rs 14.16 Lakh/annum * Preference will be given to candidates who are on direct pay-role of any city gas distribution (CGD) company and having O&M experience. * Consideration of candidature/application of candidates who are on fixed term contract/TPI/PMC/contractor with any CGD company completely lies with AGL. * 20% variable salary will be paid annually over and above to the minimum fixed CTC, subject to individual & company performance as per the prevailing policy of AGL. * Up to 40% hike on the current Fix salary may be given to outstanding candidates. # Apart from minimum CTC following additional benefits will be given as per Grade eligibility and as per prevailing policy of the company- Group Personal Accident Insurance. Group Mediclaim Insurance. Cost of Mobile Handset Reimbursement. Reimbursement of Monthly Mobile Bill. Hire-Purchase facility for purchase of Household items/Desktop/Laptop etc. Profit Linked Pay. Term Life Insurance Qualification Criteria:- ESSENTIAL:  B.E. /B.Tech. (Civil, Mechanical, Electrical, Instrumentation, Petroleum). DESIRABLE:  M.Tech. / MBA (Petro Chemical, Oil & Gas).   HOW TO APPLY   PLEASE READ THE VACANCY DETAILS CAREFULLY BEFORE APPLYING FOR ANY ADVERTISED POSITION.  THE CANDIDATE NEED TO GO TO THE CAREER PAGE OF AGL WEBSITE. CANDIDATE COULD ALSO COPY PASTE THE URL ON BROWSER https://www.aglonline.net/careers/current-openings/ IT WILL REDIRECT TO THE AGL WEBSITE (www.aglonline.net) CAREER PAGE. Last date and time for applications :- 16.05.2024 (18:00 hrs.) IMPORTANT NOTE:  ANY REVISION, CLARIFICATION, ADDENDUM, CORRIGENDUM, TIME EXTENSION, ETC. TO THE ABOVE ADVERTISEMENT WILL BE HOSTED ON CAREERS SECTION OF AGL WEBSITE: WWW.AGLONLINE.NET ONLY AND NO SEPARATE NOTIFICATION SHALL BE ISSUED IN THE PRESS. column2: The Purpose of the role is to have Continuous Improvement in the organization and to have Innovation & Changes.     Follow HOM (Hillenbrand Operating Model) practices related to Operational Excellence, Commercial Excellence.       Include supporting development of training and/or change management materials and activities to support new processes and procedures. Includes Six Sigma/Lean/Kaizen practitioners.             Job duties are routine and/or straightforward; jobholders are developing skills to perform the job; uses existing procedures to solve straightforward problems. Duties are clearly defined, limited opportunities to exercise discretion and requires consistent guidance and close supervision.             Work You ll Do:         Responsible for implementation of Hillenbrand Operating systems like Zoning / 5S / Standardization/ Problem Solving,     Responsible for the Equipment Tools & to drive, improve & sustain them. column2: Take quick round with the reliever in the entire area: -   During round try to touch each and every people and have some specific question may be which are most critical to last 2 shifts issues/area etc.       Charge will be taken during round physically area: -   Any abnormality observed need to be objected; also, information should go to HOD. Abnormality should be cleared by the doer before leaving the workplace.     Come to planning board well advanced (before shift start) and see the schedule status on the board updated and people reporting in the shift on time.     Stand at the entry point and ensure: -     Everybody reports on time at workplace and charge handover happening at workplace only.     Operator handover running machine to the reliever.     Proper allocation of part time and full-time employee considering absenteeism if any.     Ensure each and every individual should know the shift plan and what to deliver in the shift before going to workplace. It should be predefined, and changes can be only re-communicated.     Again, discuss in depth with all concerns (reliever, HOD, department planner, miscellaneous responsible persons) for schedule, investigation and CAPA to incident if any, productivity, quality issues, documents and department works to perform in the shift, this is the understanding for pre and post 3 shifts.       Report to the concern workplace: -       Instruct offline/ concern people to make arrangement of blend /SFG and any other materials for coming two shift operations.     Make responsible offline/concern people to close quality issues, perform quality activity and other miscellaneous activities (like BMR, Training other arrangements).        Batch Manufacturing: -       During area round ensure: -     People, quality systems, machine, accessories, documents, materials and all other things are in place. Ensure things are in their designed place and vice versa.     Interact with Supervisor and understand that they know shift target for output and quality.     Ask few casuals that they should know what they are doing and our requirement. Ensure training record of casual if any.     Perform critical challenge test and in process checks. Ensure no machine functioning parameters/facility by passed. Talk the same with line people simultaneously.     Check the line documents entries (BMR, Logbooks and any formats). Cross verifies with vigilance that correct document, product and manpower used.     Ensure and discuss with people that if any special precaution (like staggering during breaks, sensitive product, new product, new market, offline activity, special/critical product, new manpower, machine issues etc.     Get pending work from previous shift; get it done from them only.     Go through the BMR, blend and machine and ensure correct dose and material used.     Evaluate and challenge the working of manpower for correctness and if required retrain them.     Ensure no human intervention at any places and correct procedure being followed.     Check people should know the batch completion time, SFG quantity, batch yield will give etc.       Must be consider for the following: -       After completion of round in department report finding to the HOD.     No documentation noncompliance and manipulation on dose and process.     Keep required manpower on the line.     Focus the improvements project like Yield, Quality, Safety, Cost saving and Man hour reduction.     All report must be completed like Shift report, DPR etc.     Safety, hygiene, discipline and ISO requirements shall be followed in the department.     Ensure everybody in shift follow their responsibility.     Spend some time for innovation and initiatives in the department.     Spend time to train the people.     Spend time on other department activities like procurement, change parts, other department issues, meeting and discussion.     Ensure people should report and taking permission for each non routine jobs.     Spend some time to interact with people.     Ensure activities are on- line.     Face abnormality and talk to supervisor immediately.     Ensure and pass communication in such way that nobody should get of any partial communications; also, it shall not be transferred to other shift people.     Ensure special precaution in night shift so that people should not be sleepy.     Ensure manpower allocation for each and every activity (like operational lines, wash area, change parts, HK etc.).     Be ready to give time to next shift reliever and to take round with him.                               Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:                    At Endo, our diversity unites and empowers us as One Team, and we are committed to cultivating, and valuing, each person s unique perspective. We actively promote a culture of inclusion that draws strength from our broad spectrums of diversity, including race, ethnicity, religion, gender identity or expression, national origin, color, sexual orientation, disability status, age, and all our other unique characteristics, qualifications, demonstrated skills, achievements, and contributions, backgrounds, experiences, cultures, styles, and talents.

column2: Customer Relationship Management:    Build and maintain strong relationships with clients by understanding their needs and providing personalized service and support. Serve as the primary point of contact for all service-related inquiries and escalations.        Service Coordination:    Coordinate service requests and schedule maintenance visits according to client preferences and contractual obligations. Ensure that service appointments are scheduled efficiently to minimize downtime and disruptions.        Technical Support:    Provide technical assistance to clients and internal stakeholders regarding elevator and escalator systems. Troubleshoot issues remotely or dispatch field technicians when on-site assistance is required.        Contract Management:    Monitor service contracts and agreements to ensure compliance with terms and conditions. Review contract performance metrics and take proactive measures to address any issues or discrepancies.        Quality Assurance:    Conduct regular inspections of elevator and escalator systems to assess their condition and performance. Identify maintenance needs and recommend appropriate solutions to address potential issues before they escalate.        Documentation and Reporting:    Maintain accurate records of service activities, including service requests, work orders, and inspection reports. Generate reports detailing service performance, including key metrics such as response times and resolution rates.

column2: Biological E Limited is looking for Officer/ Sr. Officer / Executive / Sr. Executive to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     Officer:An Officer typically represents an entry-level position within an organization     Responsibilities may include:Task Execution: Completing specific tasks, assignments, or projects assigned by supervisors or managers     Support Roles: Providing support to higher-level staff, assisting in administrative duties, and contributing to departmental functions     Senior Officer:A Senior Officer holds a higher level of responsibility compared to an Officer     Responsibilities might include:Leadership: Providing guidance and support to junior staff members, supervising tasks, and ensuring efficiency within the department     Specialized Tasks: Handling more complex assignments or tasks that require additional experience or expertise     Executive:An Executive typically signifies a mid-level position within an organization and carries more responsibility than Officers or Senior Officers     Responsibilities might include:Project Coordination: Overseeing and coordinating projects or initiatives within the department     Decision-Making Involvement: Contributing to decision-making processes, providing input, and implementing strategies within their area of responsibility     Senior Executive:A Senior Executive holds a higher level of authority and responsibility compared to an Executive     Responsibilities might include:Departmental Management: Overseeing a specific department or a significant area within the organization     Leadership and Strategy: Taking a more active role in decision-making, strategic planning, and implementing organizational initiatives     Qualifications and Attributes:The educational requirements and qualifications can vary based on the industry and specific job roles     Advanced degrees or certifications might be required for more senior positions     Strong communication, organizational, and problem-solving skills are crucial for success in these roles     Senior positions often require leadership qualities, decision-making skills, and the ability to manage teams or departments effectively

Support in ensuring        the serviceability of the installations in compliance to state and        statutory requirements.  A clear, clean,        distress free Airfield Pavement is the minimum requirement for smooth and        safe operations. Organizing all required resources for execution. Keep        track of consumables, coordination with central store and maintaining        local store. Monitor and        supervision of the CAPEX OPEX work. Preparation of CAPEX works progress        report, ensuring the QA/QC. Preparation of Estimates, Bills, Keeping track of Opex         expenditures. JOB SPECIFICATION   5.1.Education   qualification and certifications  (Indicate   the level of education and certifications required) Diploma / B.E. in Civil        Engineering  Auto CAD / MS Office        applications. 5.2.Years   of Experience    (Years of relevant experience required) B. E. and 2- 4 years of experience in        construction or Maintenance of civil infrastructure preferably in road        and airport sectors. Diploma and 4 -6 years of experience in        construction or Maintenance of civil infrastructure preferably in road        and airport sectors. 5.3.Computer   skills  (Indicate the   required knowledge on software, applications, hard ware etc., that are   required) MS Office, MS Access, AutoCAD, SAP, Other ERP   systems. 5.4.Knowledge   and work skills Well versed with construction & maintenance   of pavement and buildings. column2: Role & responsibilities   Operational Management:  Lead and supervise daily operations to ensure smooth production processes.  Monitor manufacturing activities, including raw material procurement, production scheduling, packaging, and distribution.  Implement strategies to optimize production efficiency and minimize operational costs without compromising quality standards.  Quality Assurance:  Implement and maintain quality control measures throughout the production process to uphold product quality and safety standards.  Conduct regular inspections and audits to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards.  Develop and enforce protocols for product testing, sampling, and analysis to identify areas for improvement and mitigate risks. Supply Chain Management:  Coordinate with suppliers and vendors to ensure timely delivery of raw materials and packaging materials.  Monitor inventory levels and manage stock replenishment to prevent shortages or overages.  Optimize supply chain logistics to minimize lead times and enhance operational efficiency. Safety and Compliance:  Promote a culture of safety awareness and compliance with health, safety, and environmental regulations.  Train and educate staff on safety protocols and emergency procedures to mitigate workplace accidents and incidents.  Performance Analysis and Reporting:  Develop key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure operational performance and productivity. Analyze production data and performance metrics to identify trends, inefficiencies, and areas for improvement.  Prepare regular reports and presentations for senior management to communicate operational insights, achievements, and challenges. Preferred candidate profile   Candidate must a graduate with any one of the following degree- B.Tech in Operation Management, Food Science, or related field.  The candidate must have 3 plus years of experience in the FMCG Food division preferably Namkeen. Candidate must have a strong understanding of food safety regulations, quality control processes, and manufacturing best practices.  Candidate must be conversant with contract manufacturing requirements and must have spent some part of a career in handling 3P operations in food snacks.  candidate must have a good understanding of problem-solving tools (like Fishbone analysis, Why-Why analysis, Pareto chart, 80-20 rule, brainstorming).  Candidate should have knowledge of SPC. Note - Immediate Joiners are preferable

column2: Laundryheap is an award-winning and industry-leading startup that is revolutionizing laundry and dry cleaning. We collect, clean, and return customers' items in as little as 24 hours, often making us the fastest in our industry. Headquartered in the UK, our service is available in 12 international markets, and were currently in the process of expanding further across Europe, Asia, and North America. We are currently looking for a  Logistics Accounts Operations Associate  to join our fast-growing  Logistics team  at our office in  Bangalore, India.  As we are an international brand working with different time zones, we require the potential candidate to be flexible to work in shift patterns. Youll make a difference: Reporting to the  Senior Division Manager , as the  Logistics Associate  you will be responsible for supporting the  Logistics team  to drive operational excellence in Laundryheap Linen services. Operating during EU and US markets, you will be responsible for addressing inquiries, resolving issues, and ensuring the smooth operation of our driver network. The job responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Respond promptly and professionally to driver inquiries through chat platforms, and other designated communication channels. Provide accurate and detailed information about company policies, procedures, and services to drivers. Analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve driver issues ensuring effective and timely resolution, and provide feedback to the relevant departments for process improvements. Acknowledging complaints, and dealing with them (where possible) when it comes to the missing items/replacement requests, and then escalating them to Account Management where absolutely needed Collaborate with cross-functional teams to escalate and resolve complex driver concerns efficiently. Document all driver interactions, including inquiries, complaints, and resolutions, in the appropriate systems. Maintain a knowledge base of common driver-related problems and their resolutions, and contribute to internal documentation to enhance team knowledge and efficiency. Adhere to established performance metrics, service level agreements (SLAs), and quality standards. Stay up to date with industry trends, and company policies in driver development and support. Document management, summarizing processes, learning, and helping to replicate successful models across international markets where needed Working with internal teams on a series of different projects as required, to improve the overall operations. Keeping up-to-date and familiar with all departmental changes, company policies, and industry trends to understand driver development and support. Serve as the lead point of contact for all account management matters. Required Skills: Relevant years of experience should be between 2 - 4 years. Excellent communication and relationship-building skills. High Proficiency in English (both spoken and written). Email support experience. Must be comfortable analyzing data sets Ability to express and present clear logical thinking. Proficient Google Sheets skills. Experienced in the investigation of quick resolution and escalation. To-do attitude and problem-solving state of mind. Strong multitasking skills in a high-energy environment. Be flexible and supportive of the team. Experience in working in different markets internationally, with strong cultural awareness. Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or relevant field Work Schedule and Patterns: 9-hour shift (8 working hours + 1 hour break) 5 days a week: 2 week off rotational Shift timings: 5:30 pm IST to 2:30 am IST Office-based role Benefits: Night shift allowance Note: Immediate joiners are preferred. Bengaluru-based immediate joiners are preferred. We love to work with ambitious, proactive people who have a can-do attitude and are confident decision-makers. So, if this sounds like you, take this opportunity and apply to join the International Laundryheap Team today! Please complete the application form in our job portal via the link below. https://apply.workable.com/laundryheap-2/j/187E83F3E3/ In case you are not able to connect directly to the link, feel free to copy and paste the link onto your search box.

column2: We are looking for the right people people who want to innovate, achieve, grow and lead        We attract and retain the best talent by investing in our employees and empowering them to develop themselves and their careers      Experience the challenges, rewards and opportunity of working for one of the world s largest providers of products and services to the global energy industry      Under general supervision, performs all phases of the rigging up/down of Subsea Safety Systems (SSS) service line equipment on work locations for the purpose of maintaining control of wellbore fluids and providing means for well intervention and interfacing during well testing operations, by the use of (but not limited to) Subsea Well Control equipment      In addition to responsibilities, systems knowledge, competence and skills sets acquired from lower level roles, this individual will be required to mentor and train lower level personnel in areas of expertise and will be required to become a dedicated Assessor for junior SSS personnel      Regularly works within other Testing and Subsea (TSS) product service lines on location and in the workshop      Coordinates and oversees SSS Product Service Line (PSL) functions at the well site/field camp      Provides the planning necessary for the job including equipment set up, well site direction, and customer-related support activities      Responsible for the activities relative to maintaining, setting up, testing, and operating equipment at the customer location and field camp      Monitors instruments and performs necessary calculations to assure quality of data/job      Consults with customers concerning services and products, promotes good customer relations at the well site, and assures customer satisfaction with results      Properly maintains assigned equipment and monitors compliance with safety regulations and procedures      Conducts pre-job toolbox safety meetings, reviews and verifies job plan with customer representative and manages any changes required, checks/verifies equipment as per job plan, completes all job documentation to include: Job Ticket, Job History Report, CV Metrics/KPI, Job Log, Job Summary etc      Demonstrates detailed understanding of down hole hydraulics, including basic job calculations, working knowledge of wireline Blow Out Prevention (BOP) function and of basic reservoir - i e, BHP, BHT, hydrocarbon characteristics      Job tasks, correctly performed, impact indirectly on cost containment, efficiency, profitability of operations      Skills are typically acquired through completion of high school or similar education and 5 years of SSS experience      Must have successfully passed company tests or met task guideline requirements      Must meet the minimum competency requirements for Service Specialist I-SSS      Must be fully knowledgable in most aspects of SSS service line in the local area      Must be able to interpret Tool Engineering Drawings      Must be able to visually identify various tool components and ancillary equipment and assemblies as used in all local test tool jobs by type and size and explain function of each      Must be able to pressure test equipment safely      Must have demonstrated ability to work safely with hand tools      Must have demonstrated knowledge of basic rig function including, but not limited to the following:        a) Weight Indicator - What is it used for, and how it relates to our work      b) Mud System - Weights of common well fluids - what effect they can have on our equipment      c) Limitations of mud pumps, pressure reading, strokes per/min - bbls/min      d) Basic rig manifold        Excellent leadership and communication skills are required      Must be able to explain the function of the mobilization documentation      Must be able to troubleshoot most jobs with minimal direction      Must have successfully completed cross training to the level of Specialist I in a minimum of two PSL/sub PSL or qualified as an assessor or conduct Field OE, HMS/, Competency audits

column2: Job description Job Summary Responsible for ensuring that the heavy types of equipment is in safe operating condition by conducting routine maintenance and scheduling needed repairs. Accountable for Planning & execution of day to day maintenance activities of heavy mobile mining types of machinery like excavators, loaders, dozers, rock breakers, dumpers, etc. of different make (CAT, Komatsu, Doosan, Liebherr, Terex, and other models) Key Duties and Responsibilities Supervise, coordinate and schedule the maintenance of all plant heavy equipment to ensure identification and elimination of equipment breakdowns. Perform routine check on raising equipment for proper performance and inspect equipment to detect faults and malfunctions Test repaired raising equipment for proper performance and to ensure that work meets manufacturers' specifications. Clean, lubricate and perform other routine maintenance work on raising equipment. Perform any other duties as may be assigned by the Section Head, HEMM Maintenance from time to time. To ensure sustained availability of equipment for mines operation with minimum operating costs. To ensure proper housekeeping at all times i.e. before and after any maintenance works. Liaise with OEM service engineers/representatives as in equipment commissioning, warranty, product support and technical manpower development Perform all performance appraisal of staff/intending staff for proper upgrading/selection. It is the responsibility of the dumper sectional to ensure safety of men working with him in accordance with the companys safety practices/guidelines and also the safety of equipment working under his control. Any near misses/accidents is to be immediately reported to the superiors for timely actions to be taken. Interested candidate can share their resume at siddharth@bmineral.com

column2: POSITION SUMMARY: Have knowledge of taxonomy, metadata and the organization of digital assets to ensure the platform is delivering the desired assets/results. Optimize workflows for getting assets in and out of the DAM. The Intern will be part of a team that evaluate clients needs for organization and search requirements so finding assets in the DAM is extremely easy and intuitive. You will track and apply usage rights, following the asset lifecycle to prevent any misuse or untimely release of assets. You will understand the role of DAM as the core of our production technology stack. This is a 6 month's Internship. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Organize, catalog, tag and publish assets going into the Craft DAM ecosystem. Create, manage and apply appropriate usage rights records to assets in the Craft DAM to prevent the misuse or untimely release of assets. Manage and process asset fulfillment requests and workflows. Supporting MWG and Crafts values Be part of an environment of mutual respect and partnership, strategic thinking, appropriate risk taking, open lines of communication, on-going performance feedback, professional development, and adherence to agency policy. EDUCATION, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS: Graduate in Mass Media Basic knowledge of DAM, metadata and taxonomy concepts A profound love and passion for Technology Excellent collaborator working as part of a global team across multiple offices and time zones. Strong interpersonal skills, a positive attitude, and the ability to thrive in a collaborative agency environment with multi-disciplinary teams. Excellent communication skills, both verbally and electronically with the ability to understand and translate back requirements and needs. Curious and resourceful; comfortable learning new things through exploration, self-training and teamwork.

column2: FLO - Projects:      About CMR       CMR Green Technologies Limited formerly known as is Indias largest producer of Aluminium and Zinc die-casting alloys with a combined annual capacity of over approx. 4, 18, 000 MT per annum. Since its inception in 2006, it has maintained its fast-paced growth by leveraging latest technology and continuous improvement. CMR, which recycles aluminium scrap to make alloy, has 28-30 percent market share in India and is nearly three times larger than its nearest competitor. We are having strong presence at PAN India level (North, West & South) with 13 manufacturing units, 5000 strong workforce and supplies to major automotive industry in India including tier one OEMs like Maruti Suzuki , Honda Cars , Bajaj Auto , Hero MotoCorp and Royal Enfield Motors.     Position :       Project Civil     Job Band:       A     Designation:       Senior Executive/AM     No. of Posts:       1 (One)     Department: Corporate Project       Qualification: Essential :-       Candidate should have degree/ diploma in Civil Engineering     Experience:         Essential: 2 to 5 Years of experience in Projects/ Running plant operation in the Manufacturing sector     Desired:       Experience in Erection and Commissioning of Civil structural activities     Job Profile:       Site inspection of civil construction work and ensure work as per project specification     Maintenance and Inspection of Miscellaneous Civil and Structural works     Guiding the Project team and monitoring the work to ensure the work is done as per Drawings and Method Statements     Analyzing project requirements and reviewing all the project proposals wherein mapping requirements of manpower/ materials resources in which ensuring cost-effective execution as per schedule.     Maintaining daily progress reports, prepare pour cards and other documents required for billing and contractor billing.     Ensuring completion of project within the time & cost parameters and effective resource utilization to maximize the output with proper safety compliance.     Core Competencies:       Problem-Solving & Analytical skills     Analyzing project requirements, Site inspection and reviewing proposals     Documentation and Reporting     Time and Cost Management     AutoCAD     General       Age -27 to 35 years.     CTC 3 LPA to 6 LPA approx. (CTC not a constraint for suitable candidate).     Candidate should not be frequent job changer.     Notice Period- Joining period Max 30 Days. We can buy notice period, if required         If your profile is matching with our job specification, then only pl apply         Location       :       Corporate office       : 7th Floor, Tower 2, L & T Business Park, 12/4 Delhi Mathura Road (Near Delhi Badarpur Border) Faridabad, Haryana, 121003.       Metro station:       Delhi Metro Violet line -Sarai metro station(400.0 m away)

Complying with the regulations prevailing in the state, coordination with internal customers, and vendors for O&M-related contracts, and keeping various records of O&M, for financial audit/technical audit/legal compliance purposes. The candidate will be responsible for planning, organizing, scheduling, and technical and safety requirements pertaining to CGD system for execution of operations and Maintenance works, starting from establishing and manning of control room, preparation and execution of the Annual Operation Maintenance Plan, covering scheduled monitoring, operation, maintenance, statutory compliance, audit and inspection, post commissioning services to customers including preparation, maintenance, and submission of various reports. He should ensure that operations and maintenance activities are being performed in line with the requirements of PNGRBs Technical Standards and Specifications including Safety Standards for CGD. Candidate should have hands-on experience in operations and handling of City Gate Station, Odorant unit, District Pressure Regulating Skid, Industrial Metering & Pressure Reduction skid, and Commercial and Domestic installations. Candidate should be able to manage operations and maintenance practices of steel and MDPE network  CP survey, PSP Monitoring, Steel Valves, LPT, LDT, Patrolling & Network Surveillance. The candidate shall be responsible for liasioning with local authorities/Govt bodies to ensure minimal third-party activity in the vicinity of the gas network. The candidate should plan and organize activities related to Joint Meter readings within the timeline to ensure timely billing of customers. The candidate will be responsible for gas reconciliation that includes preparation and timely submission of daily consumption reports and joint meter readings. Coordination with utility laying contractor and other civil contractors for ensuring ZERO MDPE damages & NIL ACCIDENTS. # CNG RELATED ACTIVITY: Responsible for proper operation and maintenance of CNG equipments like CNG compressors, DRS, Gas engines, CNG dispensers and CS pipeline facilities etc. Should be handling the commissioning of the Steel Pipeline network. Should be handling the erection, testing, and commissioning of CNG equipment involved at CNG stations & across the city. Should be capable of doing root cause analysis of failures, breakdown of CNG equipment like compressors, engines, motors, and pipelines etc. Planning, monitoring & control of Operation & Maintenance activities of CNG stations and Gas Pipeline network over various locations to ensure uninterrupted gas supply. Hands-on experience in major overhauling of gas engines & gas compressor packages etc and day-to-day monitoring of CNG compressors, dispensers, odourization unit and other O&M assets. The Candidate will be responsible for inventory management, especially for essential spares/assets management. column2: About this role:       Wells Fargo is seeking a Process Engineering Administrator         In this role, you will:           Support process improvement initiatives, reviews, researches, compiles information, tests, and evaluates process and workflow data     Prepare process requirements     Provide operational and analytical support for Process Engineers     Assist in identifying gaps and efficiency opportunities     Make recommendations based on analyses     Provide process updates with business partners, to ensure compliance with operative policies and regulations     Collaborate and consult with peers, colleagues, and managers to resolve issues and achieve goals     Interact with internal customers     Receive direction from leaders and exercise independent judgment while developing the knowledge to understand function, policies, procedures, and compliance requirements             Required Qualification:           6+ years of relevant (Banking/Finance) industry experience     2+ years of Process Engineering/service modelling experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education             Desired Qualifications:           Experience with Business Process Design, Process Modelling, Service modelling & current & target operating models     Knowledge of RCSA.     Exposure to process modelling techniques and standard notations like BPMN, UML , EPC etc     Hands on experience with modelling tools IGrafx, ARIS, Signavio, Visio BPM etc     Should be well versed with process improvement techniques like Lean, Six Sigma etc     Experience with Risk Identification Techniques like root cause analysis will be an added advantage     Strong communication & collaboration skills to drive meetings with numerous stakeholders in order to achieve outcomes           Job Expectations:           Looking for process engineers with relevant experience on driving process improvements, process re-engineering using BPM and business modelling methodology     The ideal candidate should have exposure using clean slate approach to understand current state of the business and process, create future states by identifying opportunities to improve business processes, risks and control gaps     The role will require collaboration with multiple stakeholders to create high level and decomposed states of the processes, process attributes like metrics, KPI s, KRI s etc     Use process engineering hat to suggest process changes, improvements and measures to mitigate risk and control gaps

column2: Provide Specialist level support on Condition Monitoring of Rotating Equipment                                                                                 Condition monitoring of Rotating Equipment by using various condition monitoring techniques like vibration, oil analysis, thermography, videoscopy etc.                                                                                 Utilise on-line and off-line data acquisition techniques, analyse and provide necessary recommendation on maintenance needs to avoid major breakdown of the equipment.                                                                                 Provide technical support in development of solutions related to Rotating Equipment Analytics based on machine and operating parameters.                                                                                 Skilled in the used of Reliability Analytics to provide/develop optimised decision support in reliability improvement plans and initiatives based on condition monitoring parameters.                                                                                 Keep updated knowledge of the condition of the Rotating Equipment by monitoring, tracking, and analysing to identify the developing fault/defect.                                                                                 Keep Rotating Equipment condition healthy in compliance with associated standards and procedures.                                                                                     Job Accountabilities                                                                                     Carry out detailed analysis of condition-based data. Monitor and analyse Condition Monitoring (vibration, oil analysis, wear particle, thermography etc.) and able to carry out Rotating Equipment trouble shooting/ Root Cause Analysis for actual/ Potential failures.                                                                                 Identify inherent conditions leading to Rotating Equipment failure through various operational machine condition monitoring parameters.                                                                                 Prepare Corrective Actions recommendation on observed fault/defect/initial damage report to Maintenance, follow-up and closing.                                                                                 Propose best in class use of improved Condition Monitoring systems techniques and provide expert advice/ support to the Clients on condition assessment systems techniques.                                                                                 Aim to prevent failure of Rotating Equipment using all possible condition monitoring data information/analytical tools.                                                                                 Reduction of undetected equipment failure under Condition Monitoring program.                                                                                 Support and Participate with FMEA / RCM studies to develop specific predictive monitoring strategies for critical Rotating Equipment. column2: Position : :    Wider Width (Woven) Textile Chemical Process Operations Age:  40-50 years Industry :   Home Textiles Experience: 15+ years in Textile processing operations Expertise:  Wide width fabric Job Summary: The General Manager for Wider Width Textile Chemical Process Operations will oversee and manage all aspects of the chemical processing operations for wide-width textiles. This includes dyeing, pigment treatment, and effluent treatment processes. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in textile manufacturing, particularly in handling wide-width fabrics, and a strong background in chemical processes and operations management. Key Responsibilities: Operational Management: Oversee daily operations of wide-width textile chemical processing, ensuring efficiency and productivity. Develop and implement operational strategies, policies, and procedures to enhance performance. Monitor and manage the entire dyeing, pigment treatment, and effluent treatment processes to ensure high-quality output. Process Optimization: Identify and implement improvements in chemical processing techniques to increase efficiency and reduce waste. Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulatory requirements, particularly in effluent treatment and environmental sustainability. Utilize advanced technologies and methodologies to optimize chemical usage and minimize environmental impact. Team Leadership: Lead and manage a team of engineers, operators, and technicians, providing guidance and support to achieve operational goals. Foster a culture of continuous improvement, safety, and quality among staff. Conduct regular training sessions to keep the team updated on best practices and new technologies. Quality Assurance: Ensure all products meet the company's quality standards and customer specifications. Implement and maintain quality control procedures throughout the chemical processing stages. Address and resolve any quality issues promptly and effectively. Budget and Cost Management: Develop and manage the operational budget, ensuring cost-effective operations. Monitor expenditures and identify cost-saving opportunities without compromising quality. Prepare regular financial and operational reports for senior management. Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate with other departments, including R&D, sales, and supply chain, to align operations with overall business objectives. Maintain strong relationships with suppliers and external partners to ensure smooth procurement of chemicals and materials. Act as the primary point of contact for regulatory bodies and ensure compliance with all relevant regulations. Qualifications and Skills: Education: Bachelors degree/ Diploma in Chemical Engineering, Textile Engineering, or a related field. Experience: Minimum of 15 years of experience in textile manufacturing, with at least 5 years in a managerial role overseeing wide-width textile chemical processes. Proven experience in managing dyeing, pigment treatment, and effluent treatment operations. Technical Skills: In-depth knowledge of textile chemical processes, including dyeing, pigment treatment, and effluent treatment. Familiarity with CAD tools and process automation technologies. Strong understanding of quality control standards and regulatory requirements in the textile industry.

column1: Mechanical Engineer - Generator Rehabilitation Project - Kuwait
column2: Position : Mechanical Engineer  Salary : 500 KWD + 30 KWD for food JD : Min 12 years of Experience in Turbine/ Generator Major overhauling works.   Design and Analysis : Mechanical engineers are responsible for designing various components of the power plant, such as turbines, generators, penstocks, and other mechanical systems. They need to ensure that these components are designed to operate efficiently and reliably under the specific conditions of the hydroelectric plant. Equipment Selection : Mechanical engineers are involved in selecting the appropriate equipment for the power plant, such as turbines, pumps, valves, and other mechanical components. They need to consider factors such as the flow rate of water, head height, and power output requirements when selecting equipment. Installation and Commissioning : Mechanical engineers are involved in overseeing the installation of mechanical equipment at the power plant site. They work closely with construction teams to ensure that equipment is installed correctly and according to specifications. They are also involved in commissioning the equipment to ensure that it operates safely and efficiently. Maintenance and Troubleshooting : Mechanical engineers are responsible for developing maintenance schedules and procedures for the mechanical equipment at the power plant. They also troubleshoot any mechanical issues that may arise during the operation of the plant and work to resolve them quickly to minimize downtime. Safety and Compliance : Mechanical engineers ensure that all mechanical systems at the power plant meet safety standards and regulatory requirements. They need to consider factors such as structural integrity, material strength, and environmental impact when designing and operating mechanical systems. Planning for shutdown maintenance and coordinate with maintenance team. Budget & Inventory: Prepare Budget for Operation and Maintenance cost/activities, prepare BOQ from Engineering Drawings, Indent & Maintain optimum store inventory for operation & Maintenance.
