column1: Shift In Charge (Operations) - Lime Calcination Plant
column2: We are looking for a dynamic individual to take on the role of Lime Calcination Plant Shift In Charge. The successful candidate will be responsible for overseeing the operations and managing the production shifts at our Lime Calcination Plant. This role requires a strong technical background in lime manufacturing, excellent leadership skills, and the ability to ensure the efficient and safe operation of the plant. Responsibilities: Shift Management:  Supervise and coordinate the activities of the lime calcination plant during assigned shifts. Production Oversight:  Monitor and optimize the lime production process to ensure efficiency, quality, and adherence to safety standards. Team Leadership:  Lead and motivate the shift team to achieve production targets while maintaining a strong focus on safety and quality. Maintenance Coordination:  Collaborate with maintenance teams to schedule and execute preventive and corrective maintenance activities. Quality Control:  Implement and maintain quality control measures to ensure the production of high-quality production. Safety Compliance:  Enforce and promote safety policies and procedures to create a safe working environment for all team members. Documentation:  Maintain accurate records of production activities, shift reports, and any incidents, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements. Training and Development:  Provide training and development opportunities for shift personnel to enhance their skills and knowledge. Communication:  Facilitate effective communication within the team and across departments to ensure a smooth flow of information. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field. Proven experience in lime calcination plant operations, with at least 7 years in a supervisory or managerial role. Strong understanding of lime production processes and equipment. Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills. Ability to troubleshoot and solve operational challenges effectively. Knowledge of safety and environmental regulations in the manufacturing industry. Strong organizational and time-management skills. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
column11: Lime Calcination Plant, Plant Operations, Kiln, Cement, LCP

column1: Stock Management and Material Issuing Specialist
column2: Overview: We seek a meticulous and experienced Stock Management and Material Issuing Specialist to join our dynamic team at our jewellery factory. The ideal candidate will manage the inventory of raw materials, tools, and finished products and issue materials to various suppliers as required. This role is crucial to maintaining the efficiency and accuracy of our production processes. Key Responsibilities: 1.  Inventory Management: Maintain accurate records of stock levels, ensuring all materials and finished products are accounted for. Conduct regular stock audits and cycle counts to verify inventory accuracy. Monitor stock levels to prevent shortages or overstock situations, ensuring optimal inventory levels at all times. Use inventory management software to update and track stock movements and transactions. 2.  Material Issuing: Issue materials to the appropriate departments in a timely manner, ensuring accuracy in quantities and types of materials. Maintain detailed records of issued materials, including date, recipient, and purpose. Coordinate with the purchasing department to reorder materials as necessary. 3.  Receiving and Inspection: Oversee the receiving process for incoming shipments of raw materials and supplies. Inspect materials upon arrival for quality and quantity, ensuring they meet the companys standards and specifications. Report any discrepancies or issues with received materials to the supplier and the purchasing department. 4.  Stock Control and Organization: Organize and label stock in the warehouse/storage area for easy identification and access. Implement and maintain FIFO (First In, First Out) or other relevant inventory management methods. Ensure that storage areas are kept clean, organized, and compliant with safety regulations. 5.  Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all inventory transactions. Prepare and present regular inventory reports to the management team. Develop and maintain standard operating procedures for inventory control and material issuing processes. 6.  Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with the production and design teams to understand material needs and schedules. Communicate effectively with suppliers and vendors regarding orders, deliveries, and returns. Collaborate with other departments to identify and resolve inventory-related issues. Qualifications: Education:  High school diploma or equivalent. Experience:  Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in inventory management, stock control, or a related role, preferably in a manufacturing or production environment. Skills: Proficiency in inventory management software and Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word). Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Problem-solving skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously. Must have Experience in Jewellery Manufacturing. Benefits & Location Location: Mumbai Competitive salary and benefits package. Opportunity to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment focusing on the exciting world of  jewellery . Play a vital role in the growth and success of the company's  jewellery  brand presence across online marketplaces. Potential for career advancement within a growing organization.
column11: Stock Management, Inventory Management, Stock Control, Receiving Inspection, Material Issue, Documentation

column2: Roles and Responsibilities  Gather and organize essential information to facilitate decision-making for Project Managers and Supervisors. Monitor project schedules, ensuring timely completion of milestones and alerting Project Managers to schedule adjustments as needed. Assist Project Managers and Supervisors in customer correspondence, approvals, and documentation preparation, ensuring accuracy and timeliness. Track invoicing status versus billing plans, report discrepancies, and liaise with customers regarding payment issues. Update cost forecasts with actuals and incoming invoices, ensuring accuracy and compliance with project milestones and guidelines. Create purchase requests (PRs) as requested by Supervisors and Project Managers, ensuring completeness and accuracy. Collaborate with the Purchasing Coordinator when clarification is needed on purchase requests. Plan labour accurately based on Supervisor input, including subcontracting and installation hours. Participate in Pre-Delivery Reviews and ensure correct cost planning for accurate revenue recognition. Manage documentation for fitters and subcontractors in coordination with the Installation Resource Manager. Handle logistics requests for projects and support Project Managers and Supervisors in logistics coordination. Monitor actual costs versus plans, prepare status reports for forecast reviews, and ensure correct booking of costs. Administer change orders and variations, ensuring timely handling and communication across relevant functions. Manage contract and scope-related claims in coordination with the Project Manager, maintaining correspondence and documentation. Monitor project gates and S-Plan accuracy, maintaining schedules in the system as instructed. Compile end-of-project documentation sets for submission and archiving. Coordinate with the Project Manager and Supervisor to plan remaining costs accurately in the system after the pre-closing review. Manage system status for sales recognition, order closing, and archiving  If interested, share updated resume to recruitment@esconelevators.com or call/whatsapp 7044672684

column2: Job description We are seeking an experienced Operations Executive to join our Supply Chain department. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 2 years of experience in a similar role, with a strong understanding of supply chain operations & Installation . The Operations Executive will be responsible for overseeing and managing various aspects of our supply chain, ensuring smooth operations and efficient delivery of products and services. Roles and Responsibilities: - Develop and implement strategies to optimize supply chain operations, including inventory management, procurement, Installation  and logistics. - Monitor and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions. - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure effective communication and coordination between departments. - Manage relationships with suppliers vendors and s, negotiating contracts and ensuring timely delivery of goods and services. - Oversee the planning and execution of production schedules, ensuring on-time delivery and efficient use of resources. - Conduct regular audits and inspections to ensure compliance with quality standards and regulatory requirements. - Identify and implement process improvements to enhance operational efficiency and reduce costs. - Train and mentor junior staff members, providing guidance and support to ensure their professional development. - Stay updated with industry trends and best practices, implementing innovative solutions to drive continuous improvement. Qualifications: 1. Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field. 2. Minimum of 2 years of experience in a similar role, preferably in the supply chain industry. 3. Strong knowledge of supply chain operations, including inventory management, procurement, and logistics. 4. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and resolve operational issues. 5. Proficient in using supply chain management software and tools. 6. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. 7. Proven ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment. 8. Detail-oriented and highly organized, with a strong focus on accuracy and attention to detail. 9. Ability to adapt to changing priorities and work under pressure to meet deadlines.

column2: Job Description/Summary :     The primary function is to ensure that existing processes maintain a high level of performance, continuously review and refine those processes to make additional improvements with support from the process expert. This position will make a strategic contribution to all sites through operational and administrative enhancements that improve quality, lower costs, improve delivery, increase profits and reduce primary working capital, as well as work with the functional leaders to access, develop, and implement Lean Manufacturing Techniques as guided by Global and regional I Cube team Key Task & Responsibilities :    KEY TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES List of essential functions, major activities and the main areas of ongoing responsibility concerning the position and  precise long term results or the contributions expected of the position. Use action verbs (eg contribute, assure, direct, manage, etc) to indicate the degree of responsibility of the position with regards to the expected results. Identify the necessary components of success and the specific difficulties for the position. - Execute lean vision and strategy by serving as a champion of facility initiatives that deliver continuous improvement, culture transformation, waste reduction and/or cost savings, machine up-time, etc - Track and report key metrics on improvement activities - Deploy the lean strategy, monitor results and report progress including for roadmap projects cost savings - Maintain suitable affiliations and participate in professional development activities (internal & external to Imerys) that foster continuous learning and also supports the lean position requirements  - Provide lean employee training and facilitate correct use of lean tools  - Apply process improvement best practices/techniques, lean manufacturing techniques and project management skills in a structured project environment. - Lead and facilitate Lean initiatives that foster process and product innovation. - Coordinate the promotion of small group activities for process improvement, equipment improvement, quality improvement, etc.  - Serve as a mentor and coach for the development of Continuous Improvement steering team within the site and departments. - Support leaders with follow-up implementation of improvements and new operating standards and control mechanisms. - Act as a methodology advisor to various business unit leaders, also with support available from the ICube global/regional network. - Support operations with the deployment of various Lean Manufacturing techniques, including but not limited to, 5S, Visual Management, Total Productive Maintenance, SMED, and Kaizen events. - Identify and implement training, education, coaching and mentoring of plant personnel in Lean Manufacturing Techniques. - Assist the business in the development and maintenance of Strategy Deployment tools.  - Support and drive a culture where the business will achieve best in class status through the implementation of best practices and benchmarking activities. - Drive improvement efforts through Statistical Process Control and problem solving methodologies such as Design of Experiments, Root Cause Analysis, Process Mapping, DMAIC, and FMEA. - Follow all company safety policies and report any unsafe conditions to Manufacturing Manager, EHS Manager, and/ or Director of Manufacturing. Perform tasks/duties related to special projects or assignments   OTHER IMPORTANT FUNCTIONS Act as a project leader for small projects when required JOB SPECIFICATIONS Bachelor Degree in Operations or Mechanical or Chemical Engineering discipline 3+ years experience in Lean Manufacturing Industry Knowledge, skills, abilities & Competencies (Check the required competencies for success on the job)  Leadership  Strategic/Critical thinking  Planning & Prioritizing  Decision-Making & Problem Solving   Safety Awareness  Customer Driven Approach   Communication & Presentation Skills  Initiative  Interpersonal Skills/Teambuilding  Implementation Skills
column11: Project Implementation, Quality Management, Performance Management, Lean Manufacturing, Operations Management, Administration Management, Refinery Operations

column2: Job Description-Plant Operations Job Title:  Head Plant Operations Industry : Automobile (Plastic Manufacturing) Location : Indore (Pithampur) Job Type : Full-time Experience: ?Managerial Role with 20 to 25 years (Required) We are seeking a technically experienced person in the plastic manufacturing industry only to support our company's operations. Project and Performance Management: Manage projects effectively, overseeing material procurement, time and cost tracking, resource management, and stakeholder communication. Communication and Interpersonal Skills: Excellent communication skills and the ability to interact with all levels of the organization. Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build rapport with employees and vendors. 2.  Technical Proficiency: Superior skills in manufacturing plants, both technical and operational. Proficiency in MS Office and Excel. 3.  Leadership and Management: Proven experience in man management and effective communication in a managerial role. 4.  Qualifications: Bachelors Degree (B.E) / Master?? Degree (M.E) in Plastic Engineering or a related field. MBA (Master of Business Administration) is preferred. 5.  Professional Experience: ?Extensive hands-on experience with: Injection Molding Machines Extrusion Machines Vacuum Forming Machines
